page.title: 07Trees.
page.content: The area, being limestone, naturally produces trees such as Ash, Sycamore and Elm, although the latter is now scarce. Large shrubs -Hawthorn, Elder, Blackthorn, Wild Rose and Dogwood are also found and Hazel is common. There are also plantations which have been established, containing some deciduous woods, but also conifers like Larch. Owing to the exposed nature of the hills, shelter belts are another feature of the landscape. The National Park Authority has taken the initiative of planting new trees in Hassop avenue to replace decayed ones and also at Calver Sough on a central reservation of a road junction. These are often "exotics" such as Beech, Horse Chestnut, Cherry and Alder.
